abstract: The S.&P. 500 ended down 2.5 percent and the Dow fell 2.3 percent over concern about a credit crunch in China and the Federal Reserve’s plans for winding down its stimulus efforts.
snippet: The S.&P. 500 ended down 2.5 percent and the Dow fell 2.3 percent over concern about a credit crunch in China and the Federal Reserve’s plans for winding down its stimulus efforts.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — Global markets tumbled on Thursday over concern about a credit crunch in China and uncertainty about the United States central bank’s plans for withdrawing the monetary stimulus upon which the American economy has become dependent.

headline.main: Markets Slump Over Fed Exit Plan and China Credit Squeeze
headline.print_headline: Markets Fall on China’s Credit Squeeze and Fed’s Exit Plan
